damages to

tried, a reasonable judgment value for each category of claims would emerge so as to facilitate 
settlements. Id. at 1018. 
The Court need not expend considerable efforts outlining the differences in Watson and the 
case at bar. Importantly though, the Court notes that there was only one main event leading to the 
damages (the explosion) and only two defendants (against whom liability could be determined at 
one time). This is, of course, a far cry from the case before the Court.
